titleStmt.title: Mercurius benevolens. Nor prag. nor pol. not he, nor he. But a well-wishing Mercury. Shewing th'abuse of past and present times, with well-meant lessons, & some other rimes. New, new, new, if newes in minde may ease you; true, true, true; truth cannot sure displease you. When from the Senate-House, or court, of newes we have but small report, then with an epigram let's sport.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Hen. Brome, at the signe of the Gun in Ivy-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Jan: 31 1660 Jan. 31"; the second 1 in the imprint date has been altered to read "0".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
